intro: Primula sieboldii var. striata, commonly known as the striped primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to East Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow, often with distinctive stripes. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are heart-shaped or ovate. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding vibrant color to woodland gardens.
